00040 if ($_POST) {
00041     $LogFile= RemoveBackSlashes($_POST['LogFile']);
00042     if ($_POST['Apply']) {
00043         $View->Controller($Output, 'SetLogsConfig', $_POST['Model'], $LogFile, $_POST['Count'], $_POST['Size'], $_POST['When']);
00044     }
00045     else if ($_POST['Rotate']) {
00046         $View->Controller($Output, 'RotateLogFile', $LogFile);
00047         // httpd may be killed during rotation
00048         header('Location: '.$_SERVER['REQUEST_URI']);
00049         exit;
00050     }
00051     else if ($_POST['RotateAll']) {
00052         $View->Controller($Output, 'RotateAllLogFiles');
00053         // httpd is killed during rotation
00054         header('Location: '.$_SERVER['REQUEST_URI']);
00055         exit;
00056     }
00057 }
00058 
00059 require_once($VIEW_PATH.'header.php');

00061 if ($View->Controller($Output, 'GetLogsConfig')) {
00062     $LogsConfig= unserialize($Output[0]);
00063 
00064     $confirm= _NOTICE('Are you sure you want to rotate the logs?');

00128 PrintHelpWindow(_HELPWINDOW('Log files are rotated according to two main criteria: size and time, whichever is reached first. When a log file is rotated, it is renamed and compressed, and a new one is opened for writing.
00129 <ul><li>Count is the maximum number of compressed log files to keep.</li><li>Size is the maximum file size. The log file will be rotated when its file size reaches this value. The unit is KB.</li><li>When defines the frequency interval of rotation. This is in hours. For example, 168 means once each week. This web user interface supports only interval format, not time format for this setting.</li></ul>Asterisk (*) means don\'t care.
00130 
00131 Note that log files contain very important information about system and network activity. Statistics are generated over these log files.'));
00132 require_once($VIEW_PATH.'footer.php');
00133 ?>
